name: Dinithi Sumanaweera
title: PhD Candidate, Monash University
bio: Dinithi Sumanaweera is a PhD candidate at Monash University with a focus on Bioinformatics and Computational Biology. Her main areas of expertise lie in academic research focused on computational biology.

name: Dr. Hasini Jayathilaka
title: Consultant and Data and Analytics Specialist - Scientific and Medical affairs, Syneos Health | Forbes 30 under 30
bio: Hasini Jayatilaka is currently a consultant in the scientific and medical affairs group at Syneos Health where she works with mid-size, and large pharmaceutical organizations to develop data driven product-specific medical affairs strategy. She is also a strategic advisor for AtlasXomics, a startup company recently formed to bring to market a novel the spatial transcriptomics and proteomics technology. Hasini also serves as an investment fellow for Life Sciences Angels which is a premier angel investment group focused solely on healthcare investing, including medical devices, diagnostics, pharmaceuticals, biotechnology, and digital health.Prior to Syneos Health, AtlasXomics and Life Science Angels, Hasini was a post-doctoral scientist at Stanford University and studied mechanisms of relapse and metastasis using novel technologies such as mass cytometry (CyTOF) and Multiplexed Ion Beam Imaging (MIBI) to conduct multiparameter protein analysis. Considering that current cancer treatments ultimately fail owing to metastasis and relapse, her work uncovered new insights that will help in the development of immunotherapies by providing future avenues for therapeutic design. Hasini received her PhD from Johns Hopkins University in Chemical and Biomolecular engineering where she discovered a novel synergistic signaling pathway between interleukin 6 and 8 that is responsible for regulating metastasis. Inhibition of this pathway decreases the metastatic burden of cancer cells. Testing in pre-clinical models has demonstrated that inhibition of this synergistic cell density-dependent signaling mechanism significantly reduces effective metastasis to the lungs, liver, and lymph nodes without accelerating tumor growth. The results of Hasini's study established a novel method of solely targeting metastasis which is responsible for 90% of cancer related deaths and laid the foundation for the development of combination therapies that effectively target tumor growth and metastasis, and the establishment of bi-specific antibodies to target the synergistic signaling mechanism. Hasini was named a Forbes 30 under 30 in Science in 2018 for her contributions to cancer metastasis.
areasOfExpertise: Cancer biology, pre-clinical and clinical trials for drug development

name: Dr. Iromi Wanigasuriya
bio: Iromi Wanigasuriya is a post-doctoral researcher at the Walter and Eliza Hall institute, Department of Medical biology, University of Melbourne, Australia. During her PhD she explored the function of epigenetic modifier Smchd1 using next generation sequencing and advance imaging techniques. She is passionate about advocating for women in science and encouraging girls to enter into STEM. She will be happy to mentor and share her experience on multiple topics, including but not limited to scientific research, networking, career development, and science communication.
title: Postdoctoral Researcher at Walter and Eliza Hall Institute of Medical Research

name: Isuru Daulagala
title: Software Engineer, NVIDIA
bio: Isuru Daulagala is currently a Software Engineer at NVIDIA and has a background in Electronic Design Automation, Optimizing Machine Learning Algorithms and Reinforcement Learning. He can provide guidance in topics surrounding Machine Learning and is looking to assist students with Machine Learning competitions as part of the mentorship.
projects: Neural Informations Processing Systems Competition Track: https://nips.cc/Conferences/2019/CompetitionTrack

name: Dr. Jeewika Ranaweera
title: Principal Hardware Engineer, Oracle
bio: Jeewika Ranaweera is the Principal Hardware Engineer at Oracle based in Santa Clara, California and is a University of Toronto alum. Her expertise lies in hardware engineering and she can provide guidance and mentorship on pursuing graduate studies.

name: Lahiru Maramba
title: Software Engineer, Google
bio: Lahiru Maramba is a Software Engineer at Google and has extensive experience in Human Computer Interaction (HCI), UX, research methodology and data structures and algorithms. He has industry experience in design, prototyping and user testing and can guide students in topics relating to hardware prototyping, applied science and computing.

name: Nivanthika Wimalasena
title: PhD Candidate, Neuroscience, Harvard University
bio: Nivanthika Wimalasena is a PhD candidate in neuroscience at Harvard University and has experience in industry with research relating to chemical biology and translational research. She can provide mentorship in scientific writing, public speaking, and provide guidance with application essays and writing effective resumes.

name: Dr. Ruwandi Kariyawasam
title: Postdoctoral Fellow in Clinical Microbiology, University of Alberta
bio: Ruwandi Kariyawasam is currently a PhD candidate at the University of Toronto working on her thesis in Parasitology. She will as of Fall 2020 be pursuing a Post Doctoral Fellowship in Clinical Microbiology at the University of Alberta. She can assist and guide students interested in clinical microbiology, research or medicine.

name: Yadurshini Raveendran
title: Clinical Trial Associate at FHI Clinical Inc.
bio: Yadurshini Raveendran is a recent graduate of the Master of Science in Global Health program at Duke University. Yadurshini has global health experience from working in the field in India, Sri Lanka, and Tanzania, and her research interests are primarily embedded in addressing health disparities in resource-constrained settings, with interests in pediatric oncology, global nutrition, infectious disease, implementation science, and digital health. Currently, she works as a Clinical Trials Associate involved in COVID-19 drug trials at FHI Clinical Inc. in North Carolina, USA.
areasOfExpertise: Quantitative and qualitative research pertaining to nutrition
Human rights and women empowerment research

name: Dr. Rukshan Batuwita
title: Data Scientist, Google
bio: Rukshan Batuwita is currently a Data Scientist at Google and has a PhD in Applied Machine Learning from the University of Oxford. He has extensive experience in Applied Machine Learning and Data Science and can provide mentorship in topics surrounding this field as well as statistics and computer science.
areasOfExpertise: Applied Machine Learning and Data Science

name: Prof. Nishanta Rajakaruna
title: Associate Professor Plant Biology Faculty in Residence, California Polytechnic State University
bio: Nishanta Rajakaruna has over 15 years of teaching experience in botany, biology, and environmental sciences at the university level. He has extensive experience in research and has provided mentorship and guidance to hundreds of students over the years and is currently Faculty in Residence at California Polytechnic State University, living in residence with first year undergrads and providing academic advising and mentoring as needed.

name: Aftab Aziz
title: Media Partnerships Lead Counsel, Facebook
bio: Aftab Aziz is a media lawyer with experience across the APAC region, and is currently part of Facebook’s APAC legal team based in Singapore. He can provide mentorship in topics relating to careers and education in law and media.
areasOfExpertise: Practical application of academic knowledge in a business environment (i.e. how to support a business in your role).

name: Deepesh Jayasekara
title: Doctoral Researcher in Manufacturing Engineering (PhD) at University of Nottingham (Ningbo, China)
bio: Deepesh is a two-time Nottingham Scholar, Doctoral Researcher in Manufacturing Engineering (PhD). He is currently based in China, working with the Composites Research Group, University of Nottingham (Ningbo, China) and Zhejiang Provincial Key Laboratory of Robotics and Intelligent Manufacturing Equipment Technology, Chinese Academy of Sciences (Ningbo, China).   His research interests are in real-world utilization of digital manufacturing and accelerating digital manufacturing transformation. The key focus of his current research is on cloud manufacturing and assessing the readiness of the aerospace composite manufacturing industry in China for cloud manufacturing.

name: Dulshani Gunawardhana
title: Former Project Manager (Operations Analysis) at Facebook | M.Sc. Candidate, The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE)
bio: Dulshani Gunawardhana is a masters candidate in Applied Social Data Science at the London School of Economics and Political Studies. She uses computational methods to study political and social phenomena. She also works as a part-time Research Assistant (Data Science), analysing the impact of COVID-19 on adult social care in the UK. Prior to returning to graduate studies, Dulshani worked as a Project Manager (Operations Analysis) at Facebook. She can support students with planning out their undergraduate projects, applying for graduate school and expertise-specific guidance.

name: Prof. Hasitha Mahabaduge
title: Assistant Professor of Physics, Georgia College and State University
bio: Dr. Hasitha Mahabaduge is an Associate Professor of Physics at Georgia College and State University and currently serve as the Mary J Cinardo Endowed Chair in the Department of Chemistry and Physics. Dr. Mahabaduge was inducted to the Felton Jenkins, Jr. Hall of Fame for Excellence in Teaching and was named a Fellow of the International Society for the Scholarship of Teaching and Learning in 2020. Dr. Mahabaduge is one of the leading teacher-scholars in the State of Georgia
projects: Interactions between ferroelectric and ferromagnetic thin film layers

name: Mahendrini Ariyachandra
title: PhD Candidate, Department of Engineering, University of Cambridge
bio: Mahendrini Ariyachandra is a final year PhD candidate in the Construction Information Technology (CIT) Laboratory at the University of Cambridge. Her doctoral research characterises methods that can generate and update building and infrastructure digital twins using computer vision and pattern recognition technologies. Prior to pursuing a PhD, she received her B.Sc (Hons) degree in Quantity Surveying from University of Moratuwa Sri Lanka, where she worked as a lecturer for a year. She is currently working as a Postgraduate Teaching Assistant at the University of Cambridge, Instructor at Cloud-based Building Information Modelling (CBIM) European Training Network, and as a Principle Supervisor at the Institute of Continuing Education (ICE), University of Cambridge. She can provide guidance on pursuing graduate studies (CV preparation, proposal writing, university applications), scientific writing in interdisciplinary research areas rest at the intersection of computer vision and built environment disciplines

name: Mirantha Jayathilake
title: PhD Researcher in Machine Learning University of Manchester
bio: I am a PhD candidate in Computer Science at the University of Manchester, also currently working part-time as a research scientist at a London-based digital healthcare company. I have previously assisted teaching in modules such as machine learning and image processing at the Department of Computer Science in the university. My areas of interest are machine learning, computer vision and natural language processing.

name: Navodinee Wikramanayake
title: Technology Consulting Senior Analyst at Accenture, Netherlands | Co Founder of The Better Tomorrow Movement
bio: Navodinee is a Technology Consultant at Accenture, Netherlands and has a MSc in Cognitive Science and Artificial Intelligence from Tilburg University and a BA with a Major in Marketing from Ritsumeikan Asia Pacific University, Japan. She is the Co-Founder and Lead of The Better Tomorrow Movement, an initiative that is focused on helping young people start and scale social impact projects in their local communities. Navodinee is also a Queen's Young Leader and a World Economic Forum Global Shaper.
areasOfExpertise: Growth Strategies for social impact projects
projects: I can offer guidance on pursuing graduate studies
starting social impact projects online and entering the tech space in Europe.

name: Shalini Weerasooriya
title: Senior Manager Regulatory Affairs, Reckitt Benckiser (RB)
bio: I work in a FTSE100 consumer healthcare company in the health regulatory affairs sector. I have nearly 10 years experience working in the industry on healthcare products in partnership with industry associations and health authorities globally. Having a degree in Biomedical Science and a Master's in Public Health, I have a passion for social impact activities that involve health education and have led several projects involving youth and health professionals in Sri Lanka, Tanzania and Vietnam. In my spare time I love hiking in the Peaks and foodie on all things spicy!

name: Priyadharshany Sandanapitchai
title: Research Associate, Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, USA
bio: Priyadharshany Sandanapitchai is a research associate at the FXB Center of Rutgers University and an intern with the SPSSI-UN team. She graduated with a master’s degree in clinical and counseling psychology. She has over five years of research experience in academic and professional settings, from small-scale studies to national grants. Besides, her work at the UN focuses on promoting psychological science within the contexts of climate change, racism, gender equity, human rights, and public policy.

name: Dr. Sumali Hewage
title: Former Real-world Evidence Researcher, Danone (Singapore)
bio: Sumali Hewage is currently a public health consultant. Previously, she was a real-world evidence researcher at Danone Singapore. She has experience in both academia and industry with research on public health and nutrition. She is willing to mentor anyone interested in public health, nutrition, behavioral sciences, scientific research methods, journal publication, and planning to pursue graduate studies.

name: Yomani Sarathkumara
title: Doctoral Researcher, Australian institute of Tropical Health and Medicine
bio: PhD Candidate, Molecular Immunology Australian Institute of Tropical Health & Medicine James Cook University, Australia
areasOfExpertise: data analysis and biostats using R
projects: Importance of scientific writing and publishing your work

name: Asara Senaratne
title: PhD Candidate, Australian National University
bio: I'm a PhD candidate and academic tutor at the College of Engineering and Computer Science, Australian National University. My areas of research include anomaly detection, knowledge representation and visualization, data mining and machine learning. To put into simple words, my research is all about finding ways to identify abnormal cases in data, obtain expert knowledge on those anomalies and store this knowledge for future retrieval.

name: Gamalendira Shivapatham
title: PhD Candidate, Queen Mary University of London
bio: Gamal holds bachelor’s degree in Radiography from University of Peradeniya, Sri Lanka, and master’s degree in Biomedical Engineering from Brunel University, London. Before joining Queen Mary, he worked as a Biomedical Engineer in Malaysia and Sri Lanka.  Prior to this, he worked at International Non-governmental Organizations for their humanitarian aid projects in Northern province, Sri Lanka. Currently, he is a final year PhD Candidate in Medical Engineering at Queen Mary University of London. His research investigating novel ultrasound imaging approaches to investigate human Achilles tendon health, ageing and disease. He is also a visiting research scientist at the Inst. of Cancer Research UK.

name: Prof. Arosha Bandara
title: Professor of Software Engineering, The Open University, UK
bio: I am a Professor of Software Engineering at the Open University whose research addresses the practical problems associated with building and maintaining self-managing (adaptive) systems by combining rigorous formal techniques with concrete implementations and applications of those techniques. I completed my PhD at Imperial College London, UK in 2005, prior to which I worked as a software engineer at Sapient Corporation, USA.I can provide support as a mentor for software engineering projects and general research projects, as well as proposal and paper writing.
projects: Secure, Adaptive and Usable Software Engineering (http://sead.open.ac.uk)

name: Lakmal Meegahapola
title: Doctoral Student, Swiss Federal Institute of Technology Lausanne (EPFL), Switzerland
bio: Lakmal Meegahapola is currently a PhD candidate in Mobile Computing at the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology Lausanne (EPFL). His research is at the intersection of mobile health, social computing, and applied machine learning. Lakmal has won numerous local and international hackathons, and has led a team to become the runner-up at the Microsoft Imagine Cup 2016 World Finals. He can provide guidance on conducting undergraduate research and applying for graduate studies, in areas related to computer science.

name: Charuni Pathmeswaran
title: PhD Candidate, Climate Change Research Centre, University of New South Wales, Australia
bio: Charuni is a PhD candidate at the Climate Change Research Centre at UNSW, Australia and her research focuses on heatwaves. Besides climate research, Charuni's interests include science communication, climate education and policy.

name: Jathushan Rajasegaran
title: PhD student, UC Berkeley
bio: Jathushan Rajasegaran received his BSc in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering from the University of Moratuwa, Sri Lanka in 2018. Following his undergraduate, he spent 2 years at the Inception Institute of Artificial Intelligence, UAE, working on continual learning, meta-learning, and few-shot learning. After that, he joined the University of California Berkeley, and he is currently a first-year Ph.D. student at BAIR. His research interests are mainly in learning methods for deep neural networks including continual learning, meta-learning, and few-shot learning, and 3D vision.

name: Mohamed Athif
title: PhD Candidate, Biomedical Engineering, Boston University, USA
bio: Currently a PhD candidate in biomedical engineering at Boston University. I am interested in biomedical engineering research. My research experiences include bio-signal processing and machine learning.

name: Ruwini Cooray
title: PhD research student at Deakin University; Research Scientist; Lead - Section of Genetics
bio: Ruwini Cooray is a PhD research student at Deakin University, Australia, also contributing as the Research Scientist – Lead, Section of Genetics, Institute for Research & Development, Battaramulla, Sri Lanka. Ruwini’s research focus on neurogenetics and neurobiochemistry integrated with systems biology and biophysical nature of neurodegenerative disorders. Ruwini is also working towards the development of protein overexpression research within Sri Lanka for local drug development. Furthermore, Ruwini’s is actively working for young researcher capacity building and enhancement.

name: Dr. Pramodh Chandrasinghe
title: Consultant Surgeon and Senior Lecturer in Surgery
bio: Consultant General and Colorectal Surgeon and Senior Lecturer in Surgery at the University Surgical Unit, North Colombo Teaching Hospital, Sri Lanka. My research interests are colorectal cancer, IBD and FAP. Currently reading for PhD at the Department of Surgery and Cancer, Imperial College London.

name: Dr. Dinuka Wijesinghe
title: Strategy Lead, Google
bio: Dr. Dinuka Wijesinghe is a Strategy & Operations Lead at Google with a background in Management Consulting and has a PhD in Astrophysics form the Univeristy of Sydney. He  has extensive experience in addressing strategic business problems, business transformation, strategy planning, deep quantitative analysis and can mentor students on these topics as well as on general career development and transitioning from acedmia to coorproate careers.

name: Dr. Awanthika Senarath
title: Systems engineer at Commonwealth Bank of Australia
bio: I'm a cloud governance enthusiast. I work in FinTech transforming governance policies into technical controls.
projects: Promoting knowledge and understanding of security and privacy legal landscape in systems/software engineers.
Explore limitations in governance within cloud providers.

name: Sanath Wijesinghe
title: Lecturer in Law, Open University of Sri Lanka | PhD Researcher at School of Law at the QUT
bio: Sanath Wijesinghe is a PhD candidate at the Queensland University of Technology. His PhD research focuses on the intersection of intellectual property law and health law in the context of tobacco packaging and labelling regulations. He is also a lecturer in the Department of Legal Studies at the Open University of Sri Lanka. He is interested in providing mentorship in academic writing, legal drafting and legal research.
projects: Third World Perspectives of International Law

name: Malinda de Silva
title: Doctoral Student in High Energy Physics, Deutsches Elektronen-Sychrotron (DESY), Hamburg, Germany
bio: Malinda is a Ph.D. candidate at Heidelberg University working at Deutsches Elektronen-Synchrotron (DESY) in the field of experimental particle physics (high energy physics). His current research is on the high granularity calorimeter developed for CERN's CMS detector. He is available as a mentor for students interested in particle physics, academic research as well as for CV and motivational letter writing for university applications, especially to Germany and other European universities.

name: Dr. Durga Dharmadana
title: Academic Skills Advisor (STEM), RMIT University, Australia
bio: Durga is working as an Academic Skills Advisor in Chemistry and Biomedical Sciences at RMIT University. She has extensive research experience in biomedical research and teaching experience in pharmacology and pharmaceutical science. She can provide guidance on scientific writing, graduate studies, job applications, research (areas: biomedical science, chemistry and nanotechnology) and pharmaceutical industry.

name: Dr. Jayeni Hiti Bandaralage
title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow, University of Queensland, Australia
bio: Jayeni is a Postdoctoral Research Fellow at The University of Queensland Australia. She has earned over 10 years experience, both in academia and biotech industry. Her PhD innovation of 'The world's first high-throughput commercial meristem tissue culture technology for avocado cloning' and R&D on various plant species has equipped her with expertise in industrial plant biotechnology research, scientific publication/grant writing, science communication/networking, research commercialization and industry engagement. She is also an entrepreneur who established a plant biotech company in Sri Lanka in 2019 and looking forward to mentor student to share her experience in academic and industry fronts.
areasOfExpertise: Academic research in Plant Biotechnology (Tissue culture, Molecular biology, Breeding, Microbiology)
projects: TC protocol development of various plant species

name: Nilu Kulatunga
title: Registered Psychotherapist, Canada
bio: Registered Psychotherapist practicing in Toronto Canada. Experience in the non-profit sector in Sri Lanka and Canada. Advocate in Mental Health. Passionate about sharing knowledge regarding the mental health sector.

name: Vinoj Jayasundara
title: PhD Candidate, University of Maryland, USA
bio: Vinoj Jayasundara is a Ph.D. candidate at the Department of Computer Science, University of Maryland with a focus in computer vision, deep learning, and artificial intelligence. He has several notable publications at top research venues in his field. He can provide guidance in cutting-edge artificial intelligence research, the publication process, scientific writing, and graduate applications.

name: Ajani De Vas Gunasekara
title: Ph.D. Research Scholar in Pure Mathematics, Monash University, Australia
bio: Ajani De Vas Gunasekara is a PhD candidate and Teaching Associate in the School of Mathematics at Monash University with a great interest in discrete mathematics. Her current research project is mainly focused on Combinatorial design theory. She has published several journal articles and conference abstracts related to her field and would like to contribute both in teaching and research.
areasOfExpertise: Discrete mathematics (Algebra, Number theory, Graph theory, Combinatorics)

name: Seyon Mierunalan
title: PhD Candidate, University of Cambridge
bio: Mierunalan (Mieru) Seyon is a third year PhD in the Advanced Structures Lab at University of Cambridge. His doctoral research investigates geometry of creased shell structures, targeting applications in aerospace and civil engineering. Prior to pursuing a PhD, he received his M.Sc and B.Sc (Hons) degrees in Civil Engineering from University of Moratuwa Sri Lanka, where he worked as a graduate research assistant for a year. He is currently the Graduate Student Representative of Structures Division in Department of Engineering and a member of Christ’s College Cricket team. His hobbies involve travelling and cooking. He can provide guidance on graduate studies, work-life balance during PhD and marriage between aerospace and civil engineering.

name: Lakmin  Wickremasinghe
title: PhD Research Student in Particle Physics, Osaka University & ATLAS (CERN)
bio: I am currently working for the ATLAS experiment at CERN, which is one of the two experiments to discover the Higgs Boson in 2012. From April 2021, I will be a PhD candidate, and my focus will be analyzing data taken from the ATLAS experiment in order to search for new physics beyond the Standard Model. Although particle physics is my specialization, my MSc research involved in developing hardware (electronics), software and firmware for upgrading the ATLAS detector.

name: Dr. Chathura Sarathchandra
title: Staff Engineer, InterDigital Inc.
bio: Chathura currently is a staff researcher at InterDigital Inc. He obtained his BSc in Computer Science and his PhD in Computing and Electronic Systems at the School of Computer Science and Electronic Engineering (CSEE), University of Essex, UK. His current interests lie in the areas of mobile and distributed computing systems.

name: Thisum Buddhika
title: Senior Manager,MOHT Singapore
bio: I'm a software engineer having nearly ten years of experience. I completed my bachelor's degree in computer science and engineering from the University of Moratuwa and a master's degree in computer science from the National University of Singapore. I've worked as a research engineer in the Augmented Human Lab of Singapore University of Technology and Design, and AhLab of Auckland Bioengineering Institute, University of Auckland. In both research labs, my focus was on HCI - how to use software engineering and machine learning to solve HCI problems. Currently, I'm working at the MoH Office for Healthcare Transformation in Singapore, researching and developing solutions for chronic diseases and mental health. Apart from regular work, I've co-founded several startups. My areas of focus are software engineering, HCI, data science, and entrepreneurship.

name: Dr. Sajith Wijesuriya
title: Research intern, National Renewable Energy Laboratory
bio: Sajith was born in Sri Lanka and now resides in Colorado, USA for his research work. He obtained his PhD in Mechanical Engineering with a focus on Energy Storage and Thermal Fluid Sciences. He has expertise in energy storage, thermal sciences, resilient energy systems, hybrid energy generation, building energy modelling, and peak electricity demand shifting strategies. He currently conducts research at the National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL) in Colorado, USA. He has won multiple academic excellence awards both at undergraduate level and PhD level including the Mechanical Engineering Emeritus Faculty Choice Exemplary Graduate Student Award of class of 2020 of Colorado School of Mines. He was nominated to the Future Energy Leaders program of the World Energy Council in 2017 and 2020 from Sri Lanka. He founded the organization Science Policy Circle which is now a part of Sustainable Energy for All people-centered accelerator, accredited in the UNCCD process, and was invited to the Climate Action Summit (CAS) convened by the Secretary General of the United Nations in 2019 under the non-governmental organizations category. Science Policy Circle has also been elected the Global Focal Point organization for the SDG7 youth constituency, a dedicated space for youth engagement in UN Energy and other multilateral processes in SDG7. He was nominated to the task force of the UNFCCC Technology Executive Committee (TEC) earlier this year.

name: Hiroshan Gunawardane
title: Graduate Research/Teaching Assistant at UBC, Co-Investigator Soft Robotics Research Group at OUSLs
bio: Hiroshan Gunawardane received B.Tech. Hons. in Engineering degree from The Open University of Sri Lanka, Sri Lanka and M.A.Sc. degree from The University of British Columbia, Canada. He is currently pursuing the Ph.D. degree in mechanical engineering with the Department of Mechanical Engineering, The University of British Columbia, Canada. He received the 'Engineering Excellence Award in Sri Lanka for Invention and Innovation' in 2018, from the Institution of Engineers of Sri Lanka (IESL) and 'Friedman Award for Scholars in Health' in 2020, from Faculty of Graduate and Postdoctoral Studies and the Faculty of Medicine in The University of British Columbia, Canada. His research interests include soft robotics and biomedical engineering. He is also a former lecturer at the Open University of Sri Lanka and currently working as a co-investigator at the Soft Robotics Research Group of the Open University of Sri Lanka.

name: Dr. Sumudu Herath
title: Former PhD Candidate in Computational Mechanics, University of Cambridge
bio: Dr. Sumudu Herath completed his Ph.D. at the University of Cambridge focusing on data-driven non-linear multi-scale strategies for material systems design. He focused on applying machine learning techniques to the computational structural mechanics' domain.Prior to his doctoral studies, Dr. Sumudu obtained a first-class degree and became the batch top at the University of Moratuwa. He has won several other University awards and secured foreign internships and Germany and Switzerland during his tenure as an undergraduate at the University of Moratuwa.

name: Dr. Kasun Bandara
title: Research Fellow in Data Science, University of Melbourne
bio: Kasun Bandara is a Research Fellow at the Melbourne Centre for Data Science, University of Melbourne. He has been developing machine learning based time series forecasting architectures in collaboration with research scientists from Uber, Walmart Labs, Eastern Health Clinical School, Melbourne. His research interests are time series forecasting, machine learning.

name: Dr. Sumudu Tennakoon
title: Data Scientist, Apex Analytix
bio: Sumudu Tennakoon is currently working as a Data Scientist. After earning his Ph.D. in physics from the University of Mississippi, USA, he worked as a postdoctoral scholar at The Department of Earth, Ocean, and Atmospheric Science, Florida State University, USA. His focus in both Ph.D. and postdoctoral research was investigating elastic properties of materials at elevated temperatures using ultrasonic methods. Throughout his university education, Sumudu took extensive coursework in computer and information technology. He is skilled at working with multiple programming languages and possess good computational work experience in instrumentation and data analysis. In his current role as a Data Scientist at Apex Analytix, Sumudu is responsible for research and develop analytics solutions based on machine learning and predictive analytics. Sumudu can provide mentorships in topics related to data science, machine learning, computer programing, and physics.

name: Malsha Udayakantha
title: PhD Research Student, Texas A&M University
bio: Malsha researches on solid-state inorganic materials for phosphor and insulating applications. She is a published author, a well-versed synchrotron scientist, and an innovator. She is special trained on teaching STEM undergraduates and holds the CIRTL Associate title.

name: Chamode Wijayasekera
title: Graduate Research Assistant, University of British Columbia, Canada
bio: Chamode is currently a Graduate Research Assistant of the University of British Columbia, reading for his Masters of Applied Sciences (MASc) degree in Civil Engineering. He is a proud alumni member of the Department of Chemical and Process Engineering of the University of Moratuwa, Sri Lanka.Research areas: biofuels, waste-to-energy, environmental sustainability

name: Dr. Nadeesha Chandrasena
title: PhD, Civil Engineering | GSP. Singularity University - NASA Research Park | Finalist, MIT 35 Under 35
bio: Nadeesha Chandrasena is an expert in Urban Planning and is adept in Civil Engineering, Environment and Humanities. She was a National Key Consultant for the first ever Multimodal Transport Center Development Project in Sri Lanka. She can guide and mentor students in communication, invention and innovation.
projects:
Students assigned to Nadeesha will assist her with her research as an independent researcher:
'The contemporary issue I have been investigating as an independent research professional is, how to interconnect responsible government agencies and the neighborhood community with “Internet of Things” (IoT) technology that adapted to the context of mitigating the urban surface water flood risks in developing countries.'

name: Dr. Sadeep Jayasumana
title: Senior Research Scientist, Google Research
bio: Sadeep is a Senior Research Scientist at Google Research, New York. His research interests are in the areas of computer vision, deep learning, and machine learning in general.Before joining Google, Sadeep was a computer vision/deep learning researcher at a UK-based self-driving car startup and a London-based quantitative hedge fund.During his time in academia, Sadeep has completed a Postdoc at the University of Oxford, and a PhD at the Australian National University - both in computer vision.

name: Erandathie Jayakody
title: Expert Advisor of Royal Commission into Victoria's Mental Health System
bio: Erandathie Jayakody has expertise in mental health law and promoting service user experience to design mental health services that promote autonomy and self-determination.  She is a Tribunal Member of the Mental Health Tribunal, Victoria, Australia and most recently she was a member of the Expert Advisory Committee to the Royal Commission into Victoria’s Mental Health System, Australia.  She can provide mentoring on career planning, leadership and maintaining work life balance.
areasOfExpertise: Mental Health Law and Disabiility Law Expert
Conducting hearings and making determinations for tribunals

name: Ishan Karunanayake
title: PhD Researcher, University of New South Wales, Sydney
bio: Ishan Karunanayake is a PhD Researcher at the School of Computer Science and Engineering, University of New South Wales, Australia. His main research interests are malware detection, anonymity networks, and machine learning. He is also affiliated with the Cyber Security Cooperative Research Centre, Australia. He obtained his BSc. Degree from University of Moratuwa, specialized in Electronic and Telecommunication Engineering. He has more than two years of industry experience in working as a software engineer.

name: Dr. Anupiya Nugaliyadde
title: Post Doctoral Research Fellow, Murdoch University
bio: Anupiya is the Australian Computer Society's Medallist for the most Outstanding PhD in 2020 and working as a Post Doctoral Research Fellow at Murdoch University, Australia.

name: Vasuki Silva
title: PhD Student at UTHSC, Children's Research Institute, Le Bonheur Children's Research Institute, US
bio: To be updated

name: Mukunthan Tharmakulasingam
title: PhD Student, University of Surrey, UK
bio: Mukunthan Tharmakulasingam is a PhD candidate at the University of Surrey, UK. His research interests are mainly in applying Machine learning and deep learning techniques to predict diseases. Following his undergraduate, He worked for 4 years at LSEG Technology group as a Software Engineer developing mission-critical software for Capital markets. After that, he joined the University of Jaffna as a Lecturer, and he is on study leave now. He is also working as a Tutor and Demonstrator at the University of Surrey, UK and working as a part-time data mining consultant at Senzmate, an IoT based company in Sri Lanka. He can guide students on Machine Learning, IoT and Bioinformatics projects as part of the mentorship.

name: Gihan Mendis
title: Research Assistant, Cyber Physical Social System Lab, Purdue University
bio: I am a Ph.D. candidate in Technology at Purdue University. I received the MSc. degree in Electrical Engineering from The University of Akron, in 2016, and the BSc. Eng. (Hons) degree in Electronic and Telecommunication Engineering at The University of Moratuwa, Sri Lanka, in 2012. My research interests include deep learning algorithms, decentralize deep learning, encrypted deep learning, cognitive radar sensors, and cognitive radio.
areasOfExpertise: Radio frequency analysis with machine learning (RFML)
decentralized privacy preserving computing, deep learning on edge devices

name: Sunanda Gamage
title: Ph.D. Candidate, Western University
bio: Sunanda is a Ph.D. candidate at the University of Western Ontario, studying interpretability of neural network models and human-in-the-loop machine learning. Before starting graduate school, he worked as a software engineer for over three years at the London Stock Exchange Technology (Malabe, Sri Lanka). Sunanda is passionate about making research and engineering careers more accessible to Sri Lankan youth. He can guide you on building a strong profile for graduate school applications or engineering positions, especially in machine learning and software engineering.

name: Ranin Mendis
title: Former Head of Revenue and Operations at Joust, Sydney
bio: As an experienced entrepreneur I help fellow founders with mentoring and guidance. With over a decade of consumer finance experience with the second largest bank in Australia and as the co-founder of the largest Australian Mortgage marketplace I am able to provide and share rich insights into how to hustle, business planning, research, strategic thinking, solve problems, hack your way through to your next milestone, workflow optimisation, putting teams together, raising capital, and ask the difficult questions.

name: Sajani Amarasiri
title: Founder and CEO, KOLA GOODIES
bio: Sajani Amarasiri is the founder and CEO of Colombo Cooperative an entrepreneur hub and coworking space in Colombo, Sri Lanka with a mission to help everyone achieve their full potential. She has industry experience in supply chain management and business and can provide guidance and mentorship in entrepreneurship and personal development and branding.

name: Pramodh Senarath Yapa
title: PhD Student in Theoretical Condensed Matter Physics, the University of Alberta, Canada
bio: Pramodh Senarath Yapa (he/his) is a PhD Student in Theoretical Condensed Matter Physics at the University of Alberta. He studies the properties of matter when it is cooled to near absolute zero, and explores how quantum mechanics leads to the formation of new states of matter. His current obsession is superfluid Helium-3, which is liquid that has zero viscosity and thus can flow without friction. In 2019, Pramodh was chosen as the winner of the Dance Your PhD competition sponsored by the American Association for the Advancement of Science for his swing-dancing rendition of electron behaviour, "Superconductivity: The Musical!". Outside of various #SciComm activities, Pramodh is playing ultimate frisbee, recording music or out exploring the great outdoors! He can provide mentorship on topics related to physics research, applying to graduate school and science communication.
